div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Applica- tion of Sam Plastino for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.}} No. 3393 RETURN
TO THE HONORABLE JEREMIAH NETERER, JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON:

Now comes the respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at the port of Seattle, and for answer to the writ of habeas corpus herein, says that he here produces the body of SamPlastino, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof, and for further return and answer to said writ, here avers that he detained in his custody the body of the said Sam Plastino for deportation from the United States, as an alien person not entitled to be and remain in the United States, under and by virtue of a warrant of the Acting Secretary of Commerce and Labor of the United States, issued to him, said respondent, on March 13, 1912, and an order of the Commissioner General of Immigration of the United States issued to him, the said respondent, on March 13, 1912, which said warrant and order are in the words and figures quoted in Paragraph III of the Petition herein; and set out by reference.
Respondent attaches hereto the complete record, decision, and exhibits in said matter, which constitute a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered, prays that the said writ may be discharged, and that he may be awarded his costs about his return to the writ aforesaid in this behalf expended.
Henry M. White Commissioner of Immigration.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION. ))) SS.

Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 12th day of September, 1916.
Deputy Clerk, U.S. District Court, Western District of Washington
Deputy Clerk, U.S. District Court, Western District of Washington
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Sam Plastino for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION 12 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Edm Laken Deputy 2x
